about.title: About Me
about.content1: Hi, I'm Mehmet Kucak. An {age}-year-old from Turkey who's been obsessed with coding since I was 12. It started with me wanting to create games in Scratch, and turned into a journey through game engines programming languages, and web development.
about.content2: Web development was special for me because the idea of creating an interactive app that can be used on any platform by anyone was magical to me. With that idea in mind, I started learning technologies like React, TypeScript, NextJS, NodeJS, and PostgreSQL.
about.content3: While studying for school and university entrance exams, I've had the opportunity to participate in competitions like Teknofest, First Lego League, and various programming challenges and they taught me a lot about problem-solving, time managment, teamwork, and much more.
about.content4: Currently studying for university while continuing to build projects, improve my skills, and learn new ones. Got an interesting project or just want to talk? Don't hesitate to reach out, I'm always up for a good conversation! You can see my contact information below.

project1.title: Reddit Clone App
project1.description: A dynamic community platform where users create and join topic-based communities with real-time updates. Features user authentication, instant content synchronization, and clean RESTful routing for communities, posts, and profiles.

project2.title: Turkish Local Cuisines Mobile App
project2.description: An AI-powered culinary discovery app that introduces travelers to authentic Turkish regional foods. Uses location detection, OpenAI integration for cuisine descriptions, and Google Maps API to find nearby restaurants with reviews and ratings.

project3.title: Personal Portfolio
project3.description: A modern, bilingual portfolio website featuring interactive animations and mobile-optimized design. Built with performance optimization techniques including lazy loading, intersection observers, and efficient state management.

project4.title: Conway's Game of Life
project4.description: An interactive implementation of Conway's Game of Life cellular automaton. Features real-time simulation with adjustable speed controls, mouse-based cell drawing and step-by-step execution.
